item.title: Linking Virtual Automatic Contracts to IRL Events
item.description: How do virtual automatic contracts know that a real world event took place so that it could take a particular action? This is an interesting question that will need to be explored in some detail before virtual automatic contracts can be workable in real life. Here is my early take on three possible linkages I would recommend lawyer|coders build into smart contracts.

item.title: Automatic Virtual Contracts as Donation Support Mechanism for Humanitarian Crises
item.description: How could we leverage automatic contracts and virtual currency to speed up service delivery to populations affected by humanitarian crises in a way which will entrench local markets rather than displace them? Sounds too good to be true, perhaps it is not.

item.title: How I Would Structure Automatic Virtual Contracts
item.description: EAutomatic contracts have been occupying a great deal of my free mental energies for the past few weeks since I first learned that there are platforms in the works that will allow for such things to happen. My thoughts on this are quite nascent, as is the technology, but here are my early observations.
